meanings.definition: Any of a diverse group of eukaryotic single-celled or multinucleate organisms that live by decomposing and absorbing the organic material in which they grow.
meanings.sent1: The fungus in the forest breaks down dead leaves and branches.
meanings.sent2: The mushroom, a type of fungus, thrives in damp environments.
meanings.sent3: The fungus seemed to be having a party with all the fallen leaves.
meanings.sent4: Like a silent cleaner, the fungus quietly transforms decaying matter into nutrients.
meanings.sent5: The fungus, with its invisible work, plays a crucial role in the ecosystem.

meanings.definition: A parasitic plant lacking chlorophyll and leaves, growing in the dark and absorbing nutrients from its surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The fungus on the tree trunk was draining its host of nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The dodder, a type of fungus, wrapped itself around the plant to feed.
meanings.sent3: The fungus was like a sneaky thief, stealing from its host without a trace.
meanings.sent4: In the shadows, the fungus consumed the life force of its unsuspecting host.
meanings.sent5: The fungus, a silent vampire, sucked the vitality from the plant.
